Posted By: JSSarfin (7/9/2013 3:34:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
**He doesn't have haste.** Playing a [hill giant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hill giant) on turn four is not what you want to be doing in a red deck. [Hellrider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellrider) gets played because it closes out the game ON TURN FOUR. [Hero of Oxid Ridge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hero of Oxid Ridge) got played because it closes out the game ON TURN FOUR.   
  
Unless standard red decks get another creature that lends to an alpha strike that can happen before a [Supreme Verdict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Supreme Verdict) (on the play), it is way more likely that they will fashion themselves after the RtR block RDW and go weenie rush with creatures. Or maybe Theros will have some decent burn cards and [Young Pyromancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Young Pyromancer) will become the RDW Team Captain.  
  
Either way, a Hill Giant with no immediate board impact is not Constructed playable, and especially not comparable to Hellrider.
posts.html:
He doesn't have haste. Playing a hill giant on turn four is not what you want to be doing in a red deck. Hellrider gets played because it closes out the game ON TURN FOUR. Hero of Oxid Ridge got played because it closes out the game ON TURN FOUR.

Unless standard red decks get another creature that lends to an alpha strike that can happen before a Supreme Verdict (on the play), it is way more likely that they will fashion themselves after the RtR block RDW and go weenie rush with creatures. Or maybe Theros will have some decent burn cards and Young Pyromancer will become the RDW Team Captain.

Either way, a Hill Giant with no immediate board impact is not Constructed playable, and especially not comparable to Hellrider.

posts.post_content: Once [Hellrider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellrider) rotates, this thing will become the best red curve-topper in Standard. Until then, it might see fringe play in midrange decks that don't expect to win by turn 4. I love the power he brings. This effect was previously seen on [In the Web of War](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=In the Web of War), another card I am a big fan of. For best results, use with tokens. Both halves of [Lingering Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lingering Souls) swings for 12 in the air on turn 5.

I'm not normally good at calling out cards I believe will make a major impact on Standard.

So, here it is, I'm going to say that this card will make a pretty solid impact in Standard.

posts.post_content:
You fools! You considered me no threat this whole time, just playing lands and letting you go... You didn't even think about what would happen if you let the Battledriver stay!  
  
"You've done nothing to stop my bird army this whole time, your little Hill Giant is not threat to my little tweeties."  
They're all tapped, right?  
"Yes...?"  
  
... [Burning Tree Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Tree Emissary), into [Burning Tree Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Tree Emissary), into [Burning Tree Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Tree Emissary), into [Burning Tree Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning Tree Emissary), into [Wild Beastmaster](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Beastmaster). Oh and a [Rakdos cackler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rakdos cackler) for good measure.  
  
Take 44 crazy bird lady.

posts.post_content: Much like [Mindsparker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindsparker), this is a good card that would have been AMAZING if it were just given Haste. As it is, it's a decent Red aggro replacement for when [Hellrider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hellrider) rotates out, making your one drops much more useful late game. Hopefully another good one comes around in Theros, however; otherwise Red-aligned Aggro decks will struggle a bit.
